function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Changes in behavior and cognitive dimensions due to covid-19 response measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lingering psychological consequences of the covid-19 crisis","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to accurately predict changes associated with energy-relevant outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact on research design, sample selection, and data collection due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic-induced spurious correlation in non-experimental research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased salience and malleability of manipulated variables in experimental research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"People required to stay at home leading to higher home energy usage","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Heterogeneous restrictions leading to varied study results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of longitudinal elements leading to unstable research findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased influence of distracting factors in online research due to pandemic-related restrictions, potentially impacting data validity.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Shift towards more online research due to persisting restrictions of in-person contact, potentially affecting the representativeness of the sample.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of data privacy and confidentiality in new data collection methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of contextual factors in research findings and recommendations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for increased exposure to contagious diseases due to longitudinal studies and data collection during and after the pandemic.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Natural experiments may expose different groups of people to varying conditions, potentially leading to increased spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collaboration and convergence research may involve increased interaction and collaboration between different research groups, leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collaboration may lead to increased spread of contagious diseases due to close contact","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of transparency and reproducibility in research practices may lead to misinformation about disease management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance between research coverage of severe problems and ’low-hanging fruits’ may lead to inadequate understanding of disease challenges","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Curtailment of field-based empirical research in regions with severe energy challenges and potential epidemic impact","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to diverse perspectives and marginalized populations in scholarly research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pressure to publish frequently and focus on short-term impact","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on highly-cited and high-volume segments of scholarship","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in research focus and coverage due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbation of existing bias in social research in energy associated with the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of validity in social research in energy associated with the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limits on research approaches during the pandemic may result in important gaps in knowledge generation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct applicability of the paper may be limited due to the pandemic situation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Enduring relevance of the considerations in the paper for energy social science and research practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential limited effectiveness of a single intervention in reducing virus transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in implementing optimal mitigation policies to reduce peak healthcare demand and deaths.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of overwhelming health systems due to high transmission rates and uncontrolled epidemic growth.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The spread of covid-19 due to ineffective suppression measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact on health systems due to school and university closures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term feasibility and sustainability of suppression measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmissibility rebounded once controls were lifted, leading to a resurgence of cases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prolonged maintenance of non-pharmaceutical interventions npis and drugs until a vaccine is available.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Building population immunity through epidemic without interrupting transmission completely.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain understanding of sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in people’s response to npis","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High social and economic costs of suppression strategy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High-resolution population density data used to define areas, potentially leading to high population density contact points","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of per-capita contacts within schools being double those elsewhere, potentially leading to higher transmission rates in schools","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of 5.1-day incubation period, potentially affecting the timing of disease control measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variable infectiousness due to gamma distribution assumption","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Under-ascertainment of infections 40-50%","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of short-term immunity after recovery","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"30% of hospitalised cases requiring critical care","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overall mean duration of hospitalisation of 10.4 days","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ifr estimates at 0.9% 95% credible interval 0.4%-1.4%","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
